title: The parricide papist, or Cut-throate Catholicke A tragicall discourse of a murther lately committed at Padstow in the countie of Cornewall by a professed papist, killing his owne father, and afterwardes himselfe, in zeale of his popish religion. The 11 of March last past. 1606. Written by G Closse, preacher of the word of God at Blacke Torrington in Deuon.
author: Closse, George.
publisher: [By James Roberts] for Christopher Hunt, dwelling in Louells Inne in Paternoster-row,
notes: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
